results.title: Community life, women and the Temple of Karnak
results.creator_credit: Peter Spry-Leverton and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Ancient lives”.
John Romer focuses on the role of women in ancient Egypt and their rituals such as birthing practices as well as reading some Egyptian love poetry. Romer explains the mathematical perfection of the Great Temple of Karnak, and provides an insight into the workings of the village oracle, the supernatural and medical treatment.

results.title: Community in quest
results.creator_credit: Extension Media Center, University of California, Los Angeles, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and Lyn Littman
results.brief_description: Depicts the political realities that can prevent much needed drug programs from operating in a town. In this film the city leaders are frightened when their traditional values are threatened by unknown methods and they react negatively to a drug program which utilises sensitivity and role playing techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Extension Media Center, University of California, Los Angeles, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and Lyn Littman

results.title: Community health: the Australian concept
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Film Australia and John Sexton
results.brief_description: Produced for the Hospitals and Health Services Commission, the film illustrates current developments in the area of community health in Australia, paying particular attention to the new initiatives and trends introduced by the Health agencies.

results.title: Community health and you
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”
Talks about health in reference to our daily lives, eg water, and how we have to be careful and make sure water that reaches the community is clean and safe to consume. Also goes into general cleanliness in relation to sewerage and garbage to prevent disease entering our lives.

results.title: Community chest
results.brief_description: A college student reports on the work of the Community Chest movement in the city of Yonkers, USA. The film explains that the Community Chest is a central fund-raising and administrative organization through which various social welfare agencies receive funds according to their needs. Finance for the Community Chest is obtained from a yearly drive among all sections of the community. In this way individual agencies are relieved of the work of fund-raising, thus enabling them to concentrate on their welfare activities.

results.title: Community centres
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. Further education centres are located in major centres throughout South Australia. Shows some of the activities undertaken at Victor Harbour.

results.title: Community
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Defines the ecological community as a complex network of interrelationships among a group of plants and animals adapted to the same general physical conditions, food chains and food webs.

results.title: Communities keep clean
results.brief_description: Compares community cleaning to house cleaning and includes scenes of street cleaning, water purification, park upkeep, landfill projects and air apollution control. Emphasizes that community upkeep is a shared responsibility.
